alert.note: Alert for Northern Virginia Blue Ridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued March 02 at 9:22PM EST until March 03 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...ICE STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 7 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Significant icing expected. Ice accumulation from freezing rain around two to four tenths of an inch. Total snow and sleet accumulation accumulations of up to one inch. East to southeast wind gusts around 35 to 45 mph expected, especially Friday afternoon and evening. * WHERE...Northern Virginia Blue Ridge. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 7 PM EST Friday. A wintry mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain will overspread the area between between 6 AM and 9 AM Friday morning. Precipitation will change to freezing rain Friday afternoon before changing to rain Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice and strong winds. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commute.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
